abstract.title: Abstract

institution-wrap.institution: Council of Scientific and Industrial Research, India

custom-meta.meta-value: Science, Humanities and Social Sciences, multidisciplinary
Science, Humanities and Social Sciences, multidisciplinary

sec.title: Introduction

sec.p: In our previous findings, we have seen that the substitutional defect is more favorable in comparison to interstitial and also observed that the monodopants in general are not suitable for photocatalytic application64,65. Therefore, we have considered here the codoped cases [metal (Rh or Mn) substituted at Ti or Sr site, and non-metal (N or S) substituted at O site].

sec.title: Electronic density of states (DOS)
Optical properties
Band edge alignment
Band structure and effective mass
Conclusions
Methods

ack.title: Acknowledgements
ack.p: MK acknowledges CSIR, India, for the senior research fellowship [Grant no. 09/086(1292)/2017-EMR-I]. PB acknowledges UGC, India, for the senior research fellowship [grant no. 20/12/2015(ii)EU-V]. SS acknowledges CSIR, India, for the senior research fellowship [Grant no. 09/086(1231)/2015-EMR-I]. SB acknowledges the financial support from YSS-SERB research grant, DST, India (Grant no. YSS/2015/001209). We acknowledge the High Performance Computing (HPC) facility at IIT Delhi for computational resources.

sec.title: Author contributions
sec.p: M.K. and S.B. conceived the project. S.B. supervised overall. M.K. and P.B. performed all the calculations. M.K., P.B., and S.S. got involved in various discussion to analyze the data. All authors took part in finalizing the manuscript.

sec.title: Competing interests
sec.p: The authors declare no competing interests.
